split up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if people split up, or if someone splits them up, they end a marriage or relationship with each other
split up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Steve’s parents split up when he was four.
I thought she’d split up with her boyfriend.
Why would she try to split us up?
split up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to divide people into different groups, or to be divided into groups
split up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Please don’t split up when we get to the museum.
The teacher split up the class into three groups.
split up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to divide something into different parts
split up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The house has now been split up into individual flats.
split up.translation[0].note_box[0].item: Split up is a reciprocal verb This type of verb is used when saying that two or more people or things do something that involves both or all of them
Her mum and dad split up
Her mum split up with her dad
Her mum and dad split up with each other
split up.translation[1].definitions[0].d: an occasion when an organization is divided into two or more parts
split up.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Split-ups remain difficult in many cases because of company law obstacles.
